snippet: As his co-worker at a TriBeCa parking garage climbed the stairs to safety during Hurricane Sandy, Anthony Narh stayed behind and sought refuge in a vehicle; his body was found the next day.
abstract: Anthony Nahr, a parking garage attendant in Manhattan's TriBeCa neighborhood, appears to be the only New Yorker to die at his place of work during Hurricane Sandy; Nahr's body was found inside a vehicle, where he apparently sought refuge from rising waters; mystery surrounds Nahr's apparent decision to remain in the garage after mandatory evacuation orders had been given to all employees.
lead_paragraph: As his co-worker at a TriBeCa parking garage climbed the stairs to safety during Hurricane Sandy, Anthony Narh stayed behind and sought refuge in a vehicle; his body was found the next day.

headline.seo: Attendant Dies as Storm Floods Underground Parking Garage
headline.main: Stuck Underground, as Water Rose to the Ceiling
headline.print_headline: Underground, as Water Rose to Ceiling
